item.title: A Short In-Development Video of GTA 6 Has Surfaced Online
item.content:encoded:
A small yet highly credible video clip of GTA 6 has surfaced online. While it is from an in-development build, it does give fans an interesting insight as to how the game will look, gameplay-wise.

As one of 2026â€™s biggest upcoming games, Rockstarâ€™s Grand Theft Auto 6 has a lot riding on it. Through countless delays, fans have been eagerly anticipating driving and robbing the state of Leonida for almost 10 years. Unfortunately, the trailers have seemingly only shown cutscenes, with raw gameplay yet to be put on display. That is, however, until now, as a former Rockstar employeeâ€™s demo reel has surfaced featuring a small video snippet of potential gameplay from GTA 6.

Former Rockstar Employeeâ€™s Video Portfolio Includes GTA 6 Gameplay

Twitter user SynthPotato found the clip from a former Rockstar employeeâ€™s demo reel portfolio. The name of the employee was, of course, not disclosed. Still, the reel has several animations from other Rockstar games like Max Payne 3 and Red Dead Redemption 2, furthering its validity. From the looks of it, it seems the employee worked on a bit of GTA 6 prior to leaving.

As for what the clip is, itâ€™s not a lot. The video, available above, simply shows a character (unsure if NPC or player) dismounting from vehicles. While the first half shows a bike, the second has a render of Vice City, alongside what appears to be Lucia, one of GTA 6â€™s playable characters. It looks like it showcases how many ways the player character can dismount from a car, which is a rather neat detail.

Unfortunately, the video is all fans have to go off of for GTA 6â€™s gameplay. With the recent November 19th, 2026, delay, it may be some time before more is shown. However, if the level of detail for even the simplest of vehicle dismounts is any indication, it might be the most realistic entry yet.

What do you think of the GTA 6 video leak? Does it look better than you thought? Excited to see more? Leave a comment below and on the official Insider Gaming Discord!

For more GTA 6, check out coverage on the ongoing legal battle at Rockstar and the last trailer. Make sure to subscribe to Insider Gamingâ€™s weekly newsletter!

item.title: Fortnite Chapter 7 Season 1 Weaponsâ€”All New & Unvaulted Weapons
item.content:encoded:
A new Chapter has arrived in Fortnite with the launch of Chapter 7 Season 1, which brings the customary refresh of weapons and equipment found in the loot pool alongside it.

Fortnite Chapter 7 kicked off on the back of the huge Zero Point live event, attended by over 10 million players, which saw stars from the likes of Star Wars, Marvel, DC Comics, The Simpsons, and K-Pop Demon Hunters unite to fend off the Dark Presence.

Spring Break has now arrived in Fortnite as a result, and Insider Gaming has all the details on the new and unvaulted weapons in Chapter 7 Season 1.

All New Weapons & Equipment in Fortnite Chapter 7 Season 1

There are eight new weapons and pieces of equipment added in Fortnite Chapter 7 Season 1, including a new mobility itemâ€”Wingsuits.

The importance of Wingsuits early in the season is vital following the destruction of the Battle Bus, as surfing the waves onto the island provide limited landing spots. If you get your hands on a Wingsuit early, traversing the map becomes much easier and you can head to further locations to hunt for loot, where thereâ€™s likely to be less competition.

A full list of the new weapons and equipment found in Fortnite this season are below:

  • Iron Pump Shotgun
  • Twin Hammer Shotguns
  • Deadeye Assault Rifle
  • Holo Rush SMG
  • Vengeful Sniper Rifle
  • Arc-Lightning Gun
  • Forsaken Vow Blade
  • Wingsuit

All Unvaulted Weapons & Equipment in Fortnite Chapter 7 Season 1

Five weapons have been unvaulted for Fortnite Chapter 7 Season 1, alongside the return of the All Terrain Kart and a host of healing items.

The likes of Chug Jugs, Shield Kegs, Med Kits, Bandages, and Shield Potions remain available, while players in Zero Build can continue to find Shield Bubble Jr and Port-a-Fort items to utilize.

On the weapon scene, the return of the Enforcer AR provides options from mid-to-long range, while thereâ€™s plenty of options for short-range combat with the Dual Micro SMGs and Tactical Pistol.

All the unvaulted weapons and equipment in Fortnite this season are below.

  • All Terrain Kart
  • Enforcer AR
  • Tactical Pistol
  • Dual Micro SMGs
  • Shockwave Grenades
  • Clinger Grenades
  • Chug Jugs
  • Shield Kegs
  • Med Kits
  • Bandages
  • Shield Potions
  • Mini Shield Potions
  • Shield Bubble Jr (Zero Build Only)
  • Port-a-Fort (Zero Build Only)

What is your favorite weapon to use so far in Fortnite Chapter 7? Share your thoughts in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Fortnite, find out where to find custom Battle Bus pieces, and check out the locations of all Pump Nâ€™ Run Gas Stations.
